Reviews.Title: “overall enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: lio b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location. ten minutes walk from colosseo. not the best neighborhood regarding people.stuff quite polite and helpfull. great for what i paid

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: calamaestra
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of its proximity to the central train station. I was leading a group of students and as well as adults. Everyone enjoyed their stay here overall. The staff was very nice, though the night guy didn't speak English very well. The room was a decent size and had a small refrigerator. It was clean when I got there and cleaned everyday. The break was included, but it could have used more fresh fruit options. It was very quiet. The wifi was free worked well in my room on the first floor, but the students complained that it got weaker the higher the floor. The most annoying thing was having to get a username and password every 24 hours to use the wifi. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Sandchas
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed here. We liked because of the freindliness of staff and the location. Just a few minutes to the colosseum and manzoni metro. Rooms are small but clean. Roof terrace was delightful.Bkfst was typical of three star european hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Everrrrr”
Reviews.Author: Marc M
Reviews.Content: What I can say that maybe the 3 stars of these Hotel are maybe used for decoration because this is not a 3 stars hotel at all. The normal room is really too small. Forget about the breakfast it's just a tea, coffee & cake. Ahh there was a couple of cheese slices :) There was false fire alarm twice in 1 day, 1st was 9pm & 2nd was 4 am, you can imagine how was that night. Your important stuff in your safe box are not always safe, 1 day I complained about the bed so the reception guy took the decision to change the room by himself & transferred all my luggage without noticing me even & the most important he opened the safe box & transferred everything without my permission, so this is an indication that anyone in the reception can do whatever he wants to ur room, it their Hotel :) :) :) really the room is awful. worst hotel I have ever been. I can say high price for what they are offering. By the way it is not central Rome, it's not too far from city center but it is not.

Reviews.Title: “terrible room, awful attitude!”
Reviews.Author: pogleswood186338
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my 50th bithday celebration- I travelled with my 21 yhear old son and specified a twin room- when we arrived they claimed they didnt have a twin room and onyl after much deliiberation agreed to put a camp bed in the room for 1 night and move us to a twin the next day!- completely unsuitable! my son is 6foot 5 tall! - the next morning we politely asked when our new room would be ready-the very aggressive manager told us that he had never said that and because we had accepted a camp bed for the first night they wouldnt move us ! we were so upset and had to go out and find another hotel and incur the full cost for the novocentro- only aftert going back to check o9ut did he apologies and ask us please not to complain to easy jet or write a bad review on trip advisor- and he then tod us he would find us another room! appauling- hotel room really small, down a shabby backstreet , breakfast despite reviews was poor with no fresh fruit- dont go there if you can possibly avoid it!- there are much better hotels not far away and nearer the colusseum for not much more money!!!- additionally hotel was really noisy at night- walls paper thin

Reviews.Title: “hi price for medium qualitity”
Reviews.Author: spedro20
Reviews.Content: Beware, iam used to stay in nice and good hotels. So my review will be made by someone that as hi expectations. I went there and stayed 6nights. The location is good, 15min.walking to Colosseum,and 5min walk to metro. You dont find any good restaurant in the area. About the staff, was awful,the manager,put us in the 401Room, wich is a kind of a dollhouse, no-one can move there!So i had to complain, and then they moved me to another room,i guess they put people there just to see if they dont complain... Another thing!The price that you agree with the hotel, don't mention the EXTRA 2€/per person/per night, that you have to pay! they must forget when i asked to confirm the price.. the lady of course started talking italian, when i asked what was that extra that wasn't on my reservation...just silly. They dont change towels, the Breakfast was poor. The beds were terrible, when Iie down i was literally sank by the mattress!!! I had to awake at 6am cause, the window, just had a courtain but the sun entered with full power...Rome is tiring to visit because you have to walk a lot, and all you want at the end of night is to rest,so all i wanted was a nice sleep, but the bed was so bad, that in the next day,i was already tired! Conclusion, if you have to pay 120€/night(average),just choose another hotel!!! This is definitely a 50€/per night HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for this price”
Reviews.Author: CityTrip2gether
Reviews.Content: In January 2011 we stayed 3 nights in this hotel. The female staff was very friendly. The room was clean but we had only two thin woolen blankets (no duvet). The sound insulation could have been better but we had no problems with the noise because we were always so tired in the evening. It's not loud but we could hear some noise from the room above. Breakfast was ok: cereals, toast, fruits (no cheese or cold cuts). WIFI is free. 15 minutes walk to Termini and 3 minutes to the next metro station (Manzoni).

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: stekayLiege
Reviews.Content: quite a bargain for rome. No frills (no english tv or kettle-take your own but don't forget adapter) but clean, confortable beds, big enough room, quiet location, close to metro (it would be quite a walk to the old town!) Best of all copious breakfast in quaint room (there's even a grand piano if you are gifted) though no eggs and poor coffeewhich is a shame for a country renounedf or it. Roof top terrace great for aperitifs. Impressive view towards San giovanni. Staff friendly. easy connect to ciampino without going through termini i.e metro + bus

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: Tony_R55
Reviews.Content: The service was very good and the staff was friendly. We had a "standard" room. It was small, but with a very comfortable bed and it was very clean. Since we were out all day it was perfect for us. It was located on a very quiet street and was in walking distance of a very good restaurant called Romantica. We could also walk to the train station Termini and was very close to a Metro stop. It came with a free breakfast which was forgettable. It also had a common-use laptop in the lobby that did not connect very well to the www. But we are not complaining, the price was right at less than $100 Canadian per night.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: skygoddessDenver
Reviews.Content: We arrived one day later than expected. We had alerted hotel, but weren't sure whether we would be charged fro that firstnight or not. We weren't! After putting us in a triple room that we didn't need, we moved into a double that was perfect. The room was very quiet and clean. The air conditioning worked without extra charge. Everyone that worked there was pleasant and helpful. I would stay there again. Oh, and it was only a block and a half to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very good three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: alk643
Reviews.Content: Interesting location, friendly staff, clean room and clean towels, quiet. There is a roof garden, free wireless internet, good breakfast. Not expensive. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Location Near the City Center”
Reviews.Author: sonyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Novecento during a weekend (for two nights). The best of all, is the location, near the metro station- line A, and a few stops of the city Center- Barberini, Spagna o Temini Station-. It is located in Manzoni, in a very quiet area, near San Giovanni in Laterano. The room was no many big, but comfortable and the bath was small, but sufficient -specially the shower plate-. The problem was that the second day there are no sufficient towels! Yhte maina handicap was the breakfast, very repetitive and not many good quality -without jam and fruit-. Despite this, I recommended this plce, for their location, especially.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ttocs05
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is not bad, the neighborhood it is in is not exactly the most visitor-friendly. I did not feel safe walking through it. I got to the hotel and they were flying the US flag upside down. Took a picture of it, if you're wondering... The desk attendant, during check-in, told us he was going to hang on to our passports and give them back to us later, when what he had to do with them took a matter of 30 seconds. While this might be okay and protocol when staying in a hostel, I was not comfortable leaving my passport with him or anyone else for that matter. Room was small but clean. Had a nice balcony off the room, but it's in a shady section of town, so there isn't much to look at. The rooms have very thin walls, so I could hear conversations of people across the hall clearly. When we booked, it was listed as Rome Central... hardly. The street it was on was outside all of the tourist maps. It wasn't far from the train station, or from a stop on the Metro train, but still not what I would consider center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: WinneySouthWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel very recently and couldn't be more pleased. Although I would advise that you take a detailed map, as I did find it slightly tucked out of the way. Our room was extremely clean along with the rest of the hotel. Our room (No. 401) was amazing, a little small but an amazing sun terrace with loungers, table and chairs and a large parasol. The local metro is still under construction but it is only a 5 min walk to the next stop. Our room was very quite during the night and was serviced every day. I would most certainly use this hotel again if I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charasmatic and likeable despite some flaws”
Reviews.Author: DavidSalas
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel. And because of that it didn't really matter that the bed was uncomfortable and rickety, the drains smelt and breakfast was bland. We still felt kindly towards it and I would recomend it. It's best feature is the roof garden with it's eyeball level view to the statues of San Giovanni in Laterano. It's a simple terrace with a small allotment of tables and chairs, serviced by a noisey 3-person elevator but its size works in its favour; it has a privacy that makes you feel it's yours. The room decor was good, neutral but stylish. The fridge was cheaply priced, the TV didn't work (but who cares), and it had large openable windows, as well as air conditioning. It was clean and had just enough storage space. The great thing was the shower in the en-suite bathroom, which was fantastic. The hotel itself is situated on a quiet street about a 15min walk from the Pantheon and the center of Rome, with the colloseum on the way. It is also very near a metro station. The staff were friendly, although sometimes the doorbell must have cursed us because after midnight we always seemed to have to wake tne night clerk before he would let us in. Overall it has left a good impression...(and I should mention that the drains were being fixed when we left).

Reviews.Title: “Novecento was great!”
Reviews.Author: Breakpoint
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family to Rome, and booked the "family" room. 4 single beds into a room with private bath and balcony. The room was clean, beds comfortable, and room was modern. The staff was very helpful booking restaurants, and getting taxi's. The front desk staff have some english. The nearest (operating) metro station is about a 10-15 minute walk. The Coloseum is within walking distance (20 min.) My family arrived early in the morning, and our room was not yet ready, so we waited on the rooftop garden, which was pleasant. Breakfast was adequate, but not inspiring. Taxi's have a hard time finding the hotel, because it is on a one-way street, off the beaten path. Take a hotel business card with you whenever you leave. It has a map on the back and it will help the taxi drivers. I would stay here again if I found myself back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lakebem
Reviews.Content: This small but pleasant hotel is a bargain in busy Rome. Located within walking distance to the Coloseum and the train station, its location would be perfect when the subway station Manzioni reopens which is block away. The rooms are a little larger than the average room we saw in Florence or Venice and very clean. The street is quiet with little traffic. From the front of the hotel, one can see down to the famous San Giovanni cathedral which is the oldest in Rome. The continental breakfast has more choices than is customary. Be sure to enjoy the small rooftop patio. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore from!”
Reviews.Author: Chickaroo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in August and found the hotel to be bright, airy and clean, the breakfasts to be good and the room size to be entirely suitable to the type of holiday where you aren't going to be in your room very much! As the metro station is being repaired for the forseeable future, we made a big effort to use the bus systems to get around the city and found that a rewarding and interesting way to explore Rome. There are loads of bus stops near the hotel (it is worth buying the bus map which you can only get from bookshops for 6 euros as the routes can seem confusing) The staff were friendly to us, but we didnt realise we were meant to have been dropping our key off at reception every day as we had not been told, so you may want to keep that in mind. The main downside was that they did seem to turn the air conditioning off at night, which in the middle of August seemed a bit unnecessary. Anyway, I think it was good for it's price and a good base for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: XLT
Reviews.Content: Hotel Novecento Just returned from our stay in Rome and spent 4 days at this hotel. We selected this hotel based on its Tripadvisor rating but found that it fell short of our expectations. The rooms are clean, recently remodeled and small. The TV set is small and receives only italian TV, 4 or 5 stations. The bed itself was lumpy and thats being kind. The room was air conditoned but they had problems with it during our stay. The clerk was never clear with what the problem was, it was being repaired, it overheated, they turn it off at night etc. The day clerk was friendly and tried to help with tourist type questions but his command of the english language was very limited. the night clerk was almost rude when questioned about the air conditioner, he ended up making some sort of comment, negative about americans in italian to a person on the phone not realizing my wife speaks fluent italian. Once he learned that he changed his atitude. The included breakfast was just ok, The location is close to a metro station but that one is closed for repairs, the next is a good hike. The taxi strike during this period did not help with the location., While off the beaten path and in an area undergoing transition it still is a good value, just dont expect more than a small clean room and not much support from the staff. Two additional items that I found odd ,they dont change the bed linen every day or the towels without charging extra and they kept asking/demanding their funds up front every time I dropped off or picked up the key even though I secured all the rooms with a credit card months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This trip was our first to Rome and I have a feeling it will be our last too. So it might just be that the city isn't our style, so take from this review what you will. My wife and I have traveled a lot, and of the 6 hotels we stayed at in this last Europe trip (all of which were between ($110 & $150 euros per night...we don't do fancy) this was the only one we struggled with. While it is clean, it does not have the characteristics of its 3 star hotel rating. Minor examples are that It does not have TV except to pay, they only change the towels every two days (3.00 charge if you want everyday). The hotel is not in a nice area, though being close to the train station was a plus. Other reviews say it is convenient to a lot of tourist attractions, but I would argue that there are other areas that are much more convenient with surrounding neighborhood charm, such as the Coloseum, Pantheon area, or the Spanish Steps. Central Rome has more to offer & I would recommend staying in those areas before here. This is not a Rick Steve's recommended hotel, and of all 6 hotels on our trip this is the only one that wasn't. If you are a Rick Steve's fan, this is not the hotel for you. The streets surrounding the hotel were dirty with dog droppings, the smell of urine, and graffitii on every building, I'd say basically a 5 to 10 block radius. We had to take a cab back after dark, and it took 3 taxi drivers to figure out where the hotel was, and we still had to get out and walk. From what we could tell, this is the only hotel in the area. Again, we may be missing the point with Rome, maybe just finding a clean hotel is tough to do in that city, so this might not be a vaild review. It was certainly clean, however, if we went back, there is no question we would find somewhere else to stay, and most likely pay more to get it instead of staying at this hotel again. Again, maybe we are missing something here, in that we don't know Rome well enough, but personally we have traveled a lot, and our gut tells us this is a 2 star hotel at a good price, but a bad area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Novecento Hotel is Not Just Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novecento four nights (April 2006) and had a great time. The room was small and the staff was very friendly. The staff knows little English so it was good that we were armed with a map of the bus, train routes (purchased at a stand in Rome), English-Italian dictionary, and plenty of research done before hand. However, the staff tries to stumble through. Since their familiarity with English is rudimentary we didn't leave all conversations feeling entirely comfortable with directions,advice . . . The area was great and many sites were in walking distance. The area around the hotel seemed nicer than some areas with plenty of police patroling, many of which knew English. Just a tip the treni stazione (train station) down the street, Manzoni is closed and signs say it will be under construction through December 2006. Because the hotel's staff was friendly, room was very clean, breathtaking terrace(bigger than our room), and close proximity to sites and transportation. I give this a hotel a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, a really great place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Nixopolis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and cannot speak highly enough of it. Bright, clean, well-appointed rooms with helpful, friendly staff and a great continental buffet breakfast in the morning. Situated in a quiet side-street about 10 minutes walk from the Colosseum and about 5-10 minutes from the metro station at Vittorio (as has been pointed out, the Manzoni tube stop is being worked on at the moment - it is about 2 minutes walk from the hotel). Metro tickets are extremely good value at only 4 Euros for a daily ticket. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and have recommended it to friends and family without hesitation. For what it's worth, my top ten sights in Rome were the Sistine Chapel (naturally), San Clemente church, the Largo Argentina (where Julius Caesar was killed), the museum and church at the Diocletian Baths, the Forum site, the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, the Campadoglio, San Giovanni in Laterano (the cathedral) and St Peters. The two most disappointing were the Spanish Steps and the Santa Maria di Maggiore church.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. Have nothing but praise and have recommended to friends (a rarity for me). The hotel is clean, well-decorated and quiet at night - as suited 3 'girls' past the partying age. The staff were all friendly and helpful. An excellent continental-type breakfast is served. The surrounding area can be a bit off-putting as it is not the most beautiful but was not threatening. It has excellent metro connections, especially when the nearby Manzioni station re-opens in early 2007. Would definitely use again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super!!!”
Reviews.Author: dunc28480
Reviews.Content: Thanks for all the reviews on this little gem of a hotel. The place is small, modern, clean, central and cheap - what more can you ask? The hotel is within walking distance of most sites (e.g. colleseaum is 5/10 mins walk then you can go from there) and its about 2oo metres from the nearest metro stop. The staff are friendly, speak good English and the food good so it's worth getting B & B. A great piece of advice: if you're flying from Ciampino airport get the metro to the last stop 'Anagnina' and get a bus from there it costs 1.50 euro's instead of the 40/50 euro's for a shuttle or taxi. As young travellers we were reluctant to use the metro but it couldn't be easier and a 4 euro day pass will help you get around the city easily. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel..would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: FShawn
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Rome for my Mom and I. I read all of the reviews and decided to try the Novecento. This hotel certainly did not disappoint. We stayed for 3nts for the price of Euro 139 per nt. The staff were so friendly and recommended some trattoria's in the area. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. The bathroom was beautiful with a spacious shower stall and spotless. We had two windows in our room so we could open the shutters and check out the locals in the street below. The area is very quiet and it's in a great location. We caught the metro down the street for 1 Euro which took us to the Vatican. You are only a 20-25min walk from the Colleseum and the train station. We actually walked everywhere from this hotel to the major attractions. The breakfast room is lovely and the buffet is very good. Check out the rooftop garden. When I return with my husband. I will certainly be staying at the Novecento.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Central and reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Novecento for three nights. It was clean, modern but not huge. Breakfast was continental but tasty. Very central, two stops from termini, a walk to the colloseum and nice churches. We were delighted with it, at €140 a night it was a steal for Rome!. Compared to some prices I saw on the net. Would definetely go back. ask for Rm 401, as we had our own terraced garden. Friendly staff and the nice weather made all the difference. 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NewYoricanYankee
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel that was very clean. Staff was helpful. Very close to major attractions by subway and you can easily walk to Coliseum and Forum from the hotel. There wasn't much to the neighborhood, but it was safe and less "touristy" which was fine for me. The only drawback was the size of the rooms as they were very small by American standards.

Reviews.Title: “Double or Twin?”
Reviews.Author: SFB43
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a quieter area of Rome which is nice after being in the hustle and bustle of the centre. On arrival my friend and i found we'd been given a double room instead of a twin. Reception said that we should of asked for two beds at time of booking but in England a twin room is two beds so i presumed it would be the same in Rome. Unfortunately they couldn't change our room so i had to share a bed with my friend! I feel more could have been done to help in this situation. However although the room was small it was very clean and the bathroom immaculate. Breakfast was fine and the roof terrace was nice to take time out and read a magazine. All in all enjoyed the stay and would return although would clarify what room type next time! Rome is lovely by the way if you ignore the graffiti everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. It is ideally located about 10 minutes walk to the Colosseum and the Manzoni Metro is practically on the doorstep, which takes you anywhere for 1 euro. There are lots of nice places to eat and there is a great supermarket on the next street. The staff were very friendly and the hotel and room were immaculate. We had a third floor triple room with our own balcony with french doors. Air conditioning was great and very much needed in August. The breakfast was buffet style and plentiful. I would recommend this hotel for first time visitors due to the comfort and security it offers. It wasn't our first trip to Rome, but we will definetly stay here again when we return in the future. Also, we would recommend the San Giovanni market open every day from early till 1pm. It is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel and sells bargain clothes, shoes and jewellery. There are also great little restaurants next to the park in this area. All in all a great stay with absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: corkies
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from staying four nights. We chose the Novacento on basis of two reviews on Tripadvisor. The reviews were somewhat over the top but I wouldn't qubble too much. Accommodation, in general, is expensive in Rome and this hotel is on the less expensive side. The hotel is sited on a quiet street about two hundred yards from Metro station, Manzione, that took us quickly to all major attractions in Rome. The staff were friendly and the services very good-air conditioning, shower, bidet, refrigerated bar in room at economical rates. The only drawback was that the double room was on the small side. Breakfast was adequate and could be improved by the provision of more attractive breads and some cold meats. It was lovely to sit out ont the roof garden on balmy nights.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, newly renovated, modern yet traditionally styled, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I've ever written, but I thought this hotel was worthy of a good review. In a city of where there is an endless choice of hotels all claiming to be great, this was a an amazing find. Firstly, my priorities in a hotel are cleanliness, service, location and price. Secondary are food, facilities. This hotel gives an immediate feeling that it is run by a nice friendly family willing to do anything to ensure your stay is pleasant. It appears as though the hotel has had a recent to, no expenses spared, makeover. It is really nice inside, yet simple. The rooms have the essentials and are very modern and very clean. Bed, storage, safe, fridge, tv, air con, balcony, toilet, shower. Sound simple, but they have put it together so nicely it welcomes you after a hard day of sightseeing. Rooms I would rate as 4.5 out of 5. Breakfast was always in ample supply. Tea, coffee, juice, toast, many different pastries, cereal, cake, and more. No bacon, eggs, hot food, but these things I would expect as a luxury. It was all enough to start the day with a full stomach. The breakfast area is nicely layed out and intimate. Again it is all very clean and well miantained. (note that only breakfast is served at this hotel). Location is fantastic. Many places claim to be on the main road. But a lot of noise comes with this. This is offf the main road down a small private street which gives privacy. Nice when you want to chill on the hotel roof with a beer. I think the fact it is off the main road makes it cheaper also. The biggest advantage of its location is that it is a 3min walk from a metro stop. And the metro will get you everywhere. The tram is equally close and can take you to the colleseum in 5mins. Or you may choose to go for a pleasant walk. The hotel is only 15mins from the colleseum. Service is fantastic. All speak good english and are willing to go out of their way to ensure your stay is pleasant. Again that family owned feeling is strong. I would rate this hotel on my tough scale as 4.5/5. Perhaps loosing on the fact that I would ideally like a bath, if I was being extremely fussy. It's great for couples or single travellers. The friendly service, modern (yet traditionally styled) interior give an amazing feeling to the place. The location and price make it that much more sweeter. Highly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Novecento
HotelInfo.Address: Via Carlo Emanuele I, 12, 00185 Rome, Italy
